item.title: Best Code You've Made
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

Wouldn’t really consider it my best, but its a basic framework that only allows one connection atm, wrote it up in like 10 mins. Needs alot of improvement, as my code is quite out dated (learning from old books will do that lol)

package com.main;

import java.net.*;
import java.io.*;

/**
 * 
 * @author Emily
 * @author Java Network Programming
 */

public class Main {

	/*
	 * This program uses two threads, one to handle input from the client
	 * and the other to send output from the server.
	 */
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		int PORT;
		ServerSocket ss;
		Socket theConnection;
		try {
			PORT = Integer.parseInt(args[0]);
		}
		catch(Exception e) {
			PORT = 0;
		}
		try {
			ss = new ServerSocket(PORT);
			System.out.println("Listening on port "+ss.getLocalPort());
			while (true) {
				theConnection = ss.accept();
				System.out.println("Connection established with "+theConnection);
				InputThread it = new InputThread(theConnection.getInputStream());
				it.start();
				OutputThread ot = new OutputThread(theConnection.getOutputStream(), it);
				ot.start();
				//need to wait for ot and it to finish
				try {
					ot.join();
					it.join();
				}
				catch (InterruptedException e) {
					
				}
			}
		}
		catch (IOException e) {
			
		}
	}
}
/*
 * Contains a single filed, data will b read from one byte at a time
 * Each byte is cast to a char 'c', and printed on System.out
 */
class InputThread extends Thread {
	
	InputStream is;
	
	public InputThread(InputStream is) {
		this.is = is;
	}
	public void run() {
		try {
			while (true) {
				int i = is.read();
				if(i == -1)
					break;
				char c = (char) i;
				System.out.print(c);
			}
		}
		catch (IOException e) {
			System.err.println(e);
		}
	}

}
/*
 * Sends output to the client
 * Its constructor contains two arguments, and output stream for sending
 * data to the client, and the Input Thread
 */
class OutputThread extends Thread {

	PrintStream ps;
	DataInputStream is;
	InputThread it;
	
	public OutputThread(OutputStream os, InputThread it) {
		ps = new PrintStream(os);
		this.it = it;
		is = new DataInputStream(System.in);
	}
	public void run() {
		String line;
		try {
			while (true) {
				line = is.readLine();
				if(line.equals("."))
					break;
				ps.println(line);
			}
		}
		catch (IOException e) {
			
		}
		it.stop();
	}
}

item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“imsocruel, post:64, topic:369662”]if(cmd.equals("name")) { String playerUsername = player.getUsername(); String firstName = args[0]; String lastName = args[1]; player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Your info has been stored in our database"); Server.logName(playerUsername, firstName, lastName); }

public static void logName(String playerUsername, String firstName, String lastName) { try { BufferedWriter output = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/" + "names.txt", true)); output.write("This is " + playerUsername + ". Their real name is " + firstName + " " + lastName); output.newLine(); output.newLine(); output.flush(); output.close(); } catch (IOException exception) { System.out.println(exception.getMessage()); }

for rscservers, it writes a log of the peoples names

i.e ::name Imsocruel Lol

it writes…
this is imsocruel, their real name is imsocruel Lol[/quote]
Ah, I like the 1st name last name thing, pretty cool.
Nice to see some RSC content.

item.title: Best Code You've Made
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

this has no practical purpose that i can think of. this is an extension of a lab we did in class(web basics). we had to make a container(no object, it was just a table). and repeat the content and containers.

what this is/does.

it is a container object.

asks you how many containers and how many columns of containers you want.

li tags are hidden. li tags contain the content of the containers and how many time the content should repeat.

when the containers are to be wrote, a function stores the array of li tags’ info in to a 2d array of container objects.

the layout of the array represents the layout of how the containers will be arranged.

it has some checks in it to make the code perform like it was designed.

this isnt my best code but its some that i wrote recently.

<script type="text/javascript" src="container-object.js"></script>
<style type="text/css"> 
ul{
	visibility:hidden;
	position:absolute;
	left:0px;
	top:0px;
}
</style>

<body>
	<ul>
    <script type="text/javascript">
	var timesLooped = 1;
	var loops=prompt("how many containers do you want?","50");
	while(timesLooped<=loops){
		document.write('<li id="'+timesLooped+'">This is the content of the container of the first row, first column. </li>');
		timesLooped++;
	}
	
    </script>
	</ul>
 
	<table cellspacing="10px">
		<script type="text/javascript">
		
		var containers = new Array();
		
		function populateContainerArray(c){// c is how many columns or cells/containers per row
			var cC = document.getElementsByTagName('li');//makes an array of li tags
			var b = 0;//the current li tag
			var isCorrect = false;//should u continue making columns?
			
			//repeats until a "c"th(the # c is) of the array cC is reached
			for(var a=0;a<Math.ceil(cC.length/c);a++){
				if(c>cC.length){
					c = cC.length;
					//alert('The number of columns specified is more than how many containers there are... but i fixed it; there will be no error caused by this occurrence. Np.');
				}
				containers[a] = new Array(c);//makes a new array/row
				var e = 0;//current column
				while(!isCorrect){//when isCorrect is false loop
					if(b<cC.length){//does the next li tag exist? yes
						containers[a][e] = new container(cC[b].innerHTML,cC[b].id);//create a new container where it should be.
					} else {//no more li tags? end
						isCorrect = true;//exit loop
					}
					if(e==c-1){//is the row full? yes
						isCorrect = true;//exit loop
					}
					b++;
					e++;
				}
				isCorrect = false;//reset isCorrect
			}
			
		}
		
			//loop the rows of the table, for each row of containers
			var columns=prompt("how many columns do you want?","24");
			populateContainerArray(columns);
			
			for(var r =0;r<containers.length;r++){
			
				document.write('<tr>');
				
				//loop the cells of the table, for each of the containers
				for(var c = 0;c<containers[r].length;c++){
				
					document.write('<td>');
					document.write(containers[r][c].tableTop);
					
					//loop the content of the containers
					for(var rC = 0;rC<containers[r][c].repeats;rC++){
					document.write(containers[r][c].content);
					}
					
					document.write(containers[r][c].tableBottom);
					document.write('</td>');
					
				}//end of for(c <= ...
				
				document.write('</tr>');
				
			}//end of for(r <= ...
			
		</script>
	</table>
	
</body>

that was just a snippet i left out the rest of the pages code.
here is the external javascript file.

function container(content, repeatN){
		this.tableTop = '\
			<table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width: 380px">\
				<tr>\
					<td style="background-image:url(\'container-top380x15.gif\'); height:15px; background-repeat: no-repeat"></td>\
				</tr>\
				<tr>\
					<td style="padding: 10px; background-image:url(\'container-middle380x5.gif\'); background-repeat:repeat-y; color:white" align="center">';
		this.content = content;
		this.tableBottom = '\
					</td>\
				</tr>\
				<tr>\
					<td style="background-image:url(\'container-bottom380x15.gif\'); height:15px; background-repeat: no-repeat"></td>\
				</tr>\
			</table>';
		this.repeats = Math.floor(repeatN);
	}//end of container object

not claiming its good code. its just something i did when i was bored, and was experimenting with what we were doing in class. for some reason i fell like i have posted this b4. ya i know there are other ways to do this like jquery and stuff but i didnt feel like wasting anymore time on something that didnt have any purpose.

Note: where there are images in the container object you can delete the background image and set the background color to come thing. i could of had a external css too, that set the styles for the rows of the containers–background images and stuff. b/c the way i have it it write the style for every row of every container. to me that is resource wasteful.

Read full topic
